headline: Delicious Spaghetti Bread
description: Spaghetti, ground beef, and Italian cheeses are stuffed into a braided pizza crust and baked for a fun meal everybody will enjoy.
name: Delicious Spaghetti Bread
recipeIngredient: 1 (13.8 ounce) can refrigerated pizza dough (such as PillsburyÂ®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Transfer ground beef to a large bowl.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain. Transfer spaghetti to the bowl with ground beef; mix in spaghetti sauce and Parmesan cheese until well combined.

Unroll pizza dough onto a baking sheet. Starting with a long edge, cut the 2 outer thirds of the crust into 1-inch horizontal strips, leaving the center third uncut. Spoon spaghetti mixture onto the center third from top to bottom. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over spaghetti mixture.

Begin braiding by pulling a dough strip across the filling, then pulling another strip from the opposite side over the first strip. Pinch strips together and continue to braid until the filling is covered with braided dough.
Mix olive oil and garlic in a small bowl. Brush olive oil mixture over braid.
Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is hot and crust is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes. Cut into slices to serve.

review.reviewBody: Great for groups one loaf will feed a lot of people. Can't add too much cheese.
My family just loved this! I love the end pieces because I can eat them like a sandwich.
My braiding left a lot to be desired but this was a great new take on spaghetti and garlic bread.
Love Love Love. Quick and Easy

Spaghetti bread may sound weird, but think about how well a slice of garlic bread goes with a plate of spaghetti. My family loved this recipe. I used a mix of Asiago and mozzarella for a more pronounced cheese flavor.

I have to admit that I was nervous to try this recipe b/c it really didn't seem like something that I would like, but my little guy asked if we could try it, so I said ok. The kids LOVED it and I thought it was good. Hubby liked it, but said it was 'weird', whatever that means, lol. I did omit the ground beef only b/c it's Friday during lent and we don't eat meat on these days. This was very easy to make and baked up and cut beautifully. I didn't use the whole 8oz. of spaghetti b/c it seemed to be too much for the dough. I would make this again for the kids! Thanks for sharing. :)
